title: Caching
description: Respond to matched incoming requests with cached content

export.description: The name of the exported type

cacheId.description: Optional, specifies an id or 'key' for this policy to store cache. This is useful for cache-busting. For example, set this property to an env var and if you change that env var value, you invalidate the cache.

dangerouslyIgnoreAuthorizationHeader.description: By default, the Authorization header is always considered in the caching policy. You can disable by setting this to true

headers.description: The headers to be considered when caching

expirationSecondsTtl.description: The timeout of the cache in seconds

statusCodes.description: Response status codes to be cached - defaults to 200, 206, 301, 302, 303, 404, 410 if none specified
